newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Ringgit rangebound in thin, directionless trading.
newsitem.headline: Ringgit rangebound in thin, directionless trading.

text.p: The ringgit was rangebound in thin late Asian trading for want of fresh trading factors, dealers said on Thursday.
They said the market was not sure of the ringgit's direction in the near-term, though in the medium-term and long-term sentiment was in favour of the Malaysian unit.
"There is some consolidation, but most people are not sure of the direction," said a dealer with a Malaysian bank.
He said the 2.4820 to 2.4930 a dollar range was expected to hold in the near-term as demand for dollar was well matched by overseas demand for the ringgit.
In the morning the ringgit recovered from a mild decline caused by dollar shortcovering and selling against Singapore dollar due to Chinese leader Deng Xiaoping's death.
"There was ringgit/Sing selling in the morning on the back of Deng's death. But it did not last," said a dealer with a European bank in Singapore.
He said in a regional crisis people moved to a safe haven currency and Singapore dollar was the safest in the region. "But the market has already discounted Deng's death," he added.
At 0900 GMT, the ringgit was at 2.4857/67 a dollar. It was at 1.7407/26 Singapore dollar.
